channel.title: Morning Money
channel.description: Delivered daily by 8 a.m., Morning Money examines the latest news in finance, politics and policy — and on Fridays, Morning Money: Capital Risk highlights the downstream effects on markets.

item.title: It’s good to be rich
item.description: President Donald Trump swept into office promising a golden age.
item.dc:creator: By Sam Sutton

item.title: The ‘unsettling phenomenon’ hitting Trump’s economy
item.description: A growing economy is a good thing. Politically speaking, it may not mean much moving forward.
item.dc:creator: By Sam Sutton

item.title: How gutting the CFPB clashes with affordability concerns
item.dc:creator: By Aiden Reiter

item.title: Tech leaders cheered Trump’s AI order. Now they’re worried about what comes next.
item.description: President Donald Trump’s executive order limiting states’ ability to write their own AI regulations has caused a new wave of uncertainty.
item.dc:creator: By Yasmin Khorram

item.title: Knives out for Kevin Hassett
item.dc:creator: By Sam Sutton

item.title: The structural forces hitting Trump’s labor market
item.description: Further deterioration of the labor market would deepen the political challenges Trump faces with voters who are increasingly dissatisfied with his economic stewardship.
item.dc:creator: By Sam Sutton and Victoria Guida
item.dc:contributor: By Sam Sutton and Victoria Guida

item.title: French Hill looks to 2026
item.dc:creator: By Jasper Goodman

item.title: Porn has a debanking problem
item.description: Many advocates were caught off guard by the OCC’s explicit nod to the woes of adult entertainers who say they’ve been cut off by their banks and payment providers.
item.dc:creator: By Sam Sutton

item.title: Trump boxes in his next Fed chair
item.description: The hits keep coming for President Donald Trump’s future nominee to head the Federal Reserve board.
item.dc:creator: By Victoria Guida

item.title: The SEC’s last Democrat speaks out
item.description: Wall Street’s top regulator is laying the groundwork for a potentially massive upheaval to the rules governing finance.
item.dc:creator: By Declan Harty

item.title: Trump calls it ‘woke.’ Senate Republicans say CDFI Fund is essential.
item.description: The Trump administration’s repeated efforts to kill the Community Development Financial Institutions Fund have run into a surprising roadblock.
item.dc:creator: By Katherine Hapgood and Sam Sutton
item.dc:contributor: By Katherine Hapgood and Sam Sutton

item.title: Why the AI boom will need a safety net
item.description: Artificial intelligence is here to stay, and there’s a growing consensus that the accompanying economic and social disruption will eventually force the federal government to spend an awful lot of money.
item.dc:creator: By Sam Sutton

item.title: After AI push, Trump administration is now looking to robots
item.description: Five months after releasing a plan to accelerate the development of artificial intelligence, the Trump administration is turning to robots.
item.dc:creator: By Yasmin Khorram

item.title: The year of crypto hits an 11th-hour hitch
item.description: Bitcoin is trading 32 percent lower than its record high of more than $126,000, after recording its worst day of trading Monday since March.
item.dc:creator: By Declan Harty

item.title: How private credit could test the Trump administration
item.description: Speculation is mounting about the challenges facing non-bank lenders that control about $1.7 trillion in the private credit market.
item.dc:creator: By Sam Sutton, Declan Harty and Aiden Reiter
item.dc:contributor: By Sam Sutton, Declan Harty and Aiden Reiter

item.title: What new banking rules signal about Trump’s regulatory playbook
item.description: Wall Street banks locked in one of their first major wins from Trump-era regulators Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: By Michael Stratford and Sam Sutton
item.dc:contributor: By Michael Stratford and Sam Sutton

item.title: Congress’ sprint to the finish
item.description: The three-week window on the Congressional calendar between Thanksgiving and Christmas is poised to become a pivotal stretch for financial policy.
item.dc:creator: By Jasper Goodman

item.title: The battle over bank oversight
item.description: The Federal Reserve’s regulatory czar, Michelle Bowman, is undertaking a sweeping overhaul of bank oversight.
item.dc:creator: By Victoria Guida

item.title: For the Fed, old economic data beats no economic data
item.dc:creator: By Sam Sutton

item.title: The banks' delicate dance
item.description: JPMorgan and other big Wall Street institutions are navigating opposing forces in Trump’s Washington.
item.dc:creator: By Aiden Reiter

item.title: Summers slips into fall
item.description: The Larry Summers era is over.
item.dc:creator: By Victoria Guida, Sam Sutton and Michael Stratford
item.dc:contributor: By Victoria Guida, Sam Sutton and Michael Stratford

item.title: The Windy City’s Treasury market #resistance
item.description: Rank-and-file Democratic voters are increasingly rewarding state and local leaders who break from conventional wisdom on policy and politicking.
item.dc:creator: By Sam Sutton

item.title: Treasury’s crypto headache
item.description: A high-stakes lobbying war between banks and cryptocurrency companies is becoming a new headache for the Trump administration.
item.dc:creator: By Jasper Goodman

item.title: America’s $6 billion ‘seed fund’ has gone dark
item.description: The longest government shutdown in U.S. history may be nearing an end, but for a lapsed $6 billion small business innovation lifeline, there is still no solution in sight.
item.dc:creator: By Katherine Hapgood

item.title: Trump’s got a paycheck problem
item.description: The drubbing Republicans took at the ballot box last week highlighted President Donald Trump’s weakness on the issue of affordability.
item.dc:creator: By Sam Sutton

item.title: Tick tock: The clock gets louder for Atkins’ SEC
item.description: Securities and Exchange Commission Chair Paul Atkins has big plans for his agency, but less and less time to get them done.
item.dc:creator: By Declan Harty

item.title: ‘It’s a yellow brick road for tech companies’
item.description: Astronomical investment in artificial intelligence is only accelerating. But that spending is increasingly coming from borrowing, rather than cash.
item.dc:creator: By Yasmin Khorram

item.title: Mamdani wins. Wall Street survives.
item.description: The capital of global finance will wake up this morning to the reality that a self-avowed democratic socialist is about to become its next mayor.
item.dc:creator: By Sam Sutton, Aiden Reiter and Declan Harty
item.dc:contributor: By Sam Sutton, Aiden Reiter and Declan Harty

item.title: CFPB’s breaking point
item.description: Months of turmoil at the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau are set to reach a breaking point in the coming weeks.
item.dc:creator: By Michael Stratford
